title: 115_hr3077
content: The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203, including changes to benefits termination upon deportation and exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions related to deductions for work and exemptions from reductions based on entitlements to child's insurance benefits. It also addresses the suspension of aliens' benefits. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends various sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions related to deductions for work, suspension of aliens' benefits, and penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends sections of the Social Security Act related to deductions for work, benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for SSI purposes. Section 1612(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to redefine the term 'wages' for SSI purposes, excluding certain limitations on remuneration amounts. Services performed by an individual as an employee within or outside the United States are considered employment if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net earnings or net loss from self-employment for title II purposes. States in the military or naval services of the United States are considered employment if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net earnings. The term 'wages' excludes certain payments made on behalf of an employee or dependents for retirement. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to repeal deductions on account of work under the program. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove subsections (f) and (g)(2), with conforming amendments to sections 3(f)(1) and 4(g)(2). The effective date for these changes is for taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
